cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest today, turning north tonight and then north-northeast on Wednesday, tracking inland across north-Florida’s Gulf Coast, then accelerating northeastward across Georgia‒Carolinas and the mid-Atlantic seaboard toward New England and the Canadian Maritimes
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / north-Florida Gulf coast (near Steinhatchee River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of St. Marys River, GA to South Santee River, SC (tropical-storm watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys to Ochlockonee River and Bonita Beach to Aucilla River, FL (tropical-storm warning); Bonita Beach to Aucilla River, FL including Tampa Bay (storm-surge warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast, Big Bend, coastal Georgia and South Carolina, then the entire mid-Atlantic and southern New England coastline
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible 25–35 mph with a very low (3 %) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge possible (generally <1 ft) in the upper Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible Thursday night–Friday, producing localized ponding and brief visibility reductions
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk may reach the Mid-Atlantic on Thursday; rough seas and elevated rip-current risk along the Delmarva coast
